item.title: 'Delhi I Love You': Can you love India's most reviled city? - BBC News
item.description:
'Delhi I Love You': Can you love India's most reviled city? - BBC News

Delhi I Love You is a 30-month-long festival to let people show their love for the Indian capital, but can it make people love the country's most reviled city, asks the BBC's Geeta Pandey The Indian capital is a city of extreme contradictions - if the summer heat doesn't burn you alive, the winter chill can freeze your soul.

item.title: #ADAYINDELHI
item.description:
#ADAYINDELHI

What if we looked at Delhi with new eyes? It's time to focus on what makes Delhi a city worth celebrating: its initiatives, its creativity, its history, its food, its stories, and its people. This video -A day in Delhi- is call to the citizens of Delhi to really feel their city,  to be proud of where they live, and to join theDelhi, I Love Youmovement. The video tries to capture the many souls that make up the city of Delhi, telling us their stories without saying a word.
